results.title: Games futurists play
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
An examination of some of the methods humans are utilising in their search for knowledge of existing social problems as well as projected social problems of the future. This film introduces us to new games now being played to prepare us for tomorrow. As we witness three such games, we see that apart from their childish role-playing aspect they can be constructive also.

results.title: The Four day week
results.creator_credit: Gordon Hyatt, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses some issues related to work in the future-30 hour week, automatic unionism, early retirement. Also looks at some of the consequences of these ideas, especially the use of leisure and recreation facilities. Reported by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Food revolution
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Burton Benjamin, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Explains some of the pilot projects on which scientists are working as they attempt to cope with the problems of food shortage and exploding population in the 21st century. At least one and a half million people are being damaged in body and in mind because they do not have enough to eat. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Fighting fear with fear
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Burton Benjamin, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Neurotic behaviour is just a bad habit that can be unlearned. This is the basis of a contronversial psychotherapeutic technique developed by Drs Thomas Stampfi and Donald Lewis. In the film, a 23 year-old secretary is treated with a bombardment of the terrifying situation she fears most. According to Stampfi and Lewis, facing fear head-on breaks down the neurosis so she can relearn what may make her happiest.

results.title: Computer revolution. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A timely - even frightening - reminder of the rapid advance computers are making into our lives. In many fields the impersonal efficient machine is shaping and controlling our destinies. The film points to the ever-increasing reliance on computers and illustrates computer applications of today and in the future specifically in production, aviation, medicine, education, law-enforcement, rocket space travel, design, communication etc. Implications for citizens’ rights to privacy. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Communications explosion
results.creator_credit: James B. Faichney, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Briadcasting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Probable future communication methods and systems, emphasising use of computers. Some experimental devices are shown illustrating verbal computer input and output.

results.title: The Class of '01: the college of tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A glimpse of what the universities of the future (2001) will be like. Examines new multi-media methods such as computerised control centres and closed circuit TV. Community colleges and the possible “bottling in film” of great professors are explained. Advanced methods of teacher training and new educational technologies are shown, and the question of what will happen to the creative processes in tomorrow’s classrooms is explored. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.
results.title_for_label: The Class of ‘01: the college of tomorrow
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System

results.title: Cities of the future
results.creator_credit: Gordon Hyatt, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses radical approaches to town planning, showing various concepts. The totally planned new city, Brasilia; incorporation of historic elements as in Philadelphia; pedestrian areas in Miami and Montreal; planned residential extensions; and suggested new construction methods. Exciting architectural ideas include: weather-proofed cities, mega-structures surrounded by green-belts, multi-level cities and floating cities. Features some animated scenes. Narrated by Walter Cronkite and animated by John Hubley.

results.title: A Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A group of college students get together in a “circle of love”, ie an “encounter group” to improve interpersonal relationships. Comprises highlights from several sessions in which six students, who have never met before, react to taped instructions from a behavioural research institute. Participants learn to express their real feelings about themselves and their fellow students, and learn to overcome anxieties and shyness in the presence of others. Reporter: Walter Cronkite
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions

results.title: Bats, birds and bionics
results.creator_credit: John MacDonald, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Demonstrates the application of the principles of natural systems in living animals such as bats, rattlesnakes, frogs and rats, to engineering devices to guide blind persons, self guiding missiles, photoelectric scanners capable of distinguishing shapes and bionic computers designed to learn and to control man-like robots. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.
